alert.note: Alert for Madison (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 11:57PM EDT until April 01 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT FOR SOUTHERN MADISON...SHELBY...HANCOCK...RUSH...NORTHERN DECATUR... EASTERN JOHNSON...HENRY AND SOUTHEASTERN MARION COUNTIES... At 1156 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Albany to near Greenfield to near Franklin, moving east at 80 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Anderson, Shelbyville, Franklin, Greenfield, New Castle, Greensburg, Rushville, Adams, Cumberland, Edinburgh, Pendleton, Fortville, Ingalls, Knightstown, New Palestine, Flat Rock, Milford, Geneva, Morristown and St. Paul. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for central and east central Indiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
